snippet: A weekend of activity serves as an indication that a crackdown continues under the new president, Abdel Fattah el-Sisi.
abstract: Egyptian police confiscate human rights group's newsletter, arrest two activists for paper sign criticizing police and shut down two grocery store chains that reportedly have ties to Muslim brotherhood; actions, coming less than week after inauguration of Pres Adbel Fattah el-Sisi, indicate that his administration intends to continue crackdown on dissent.
lead_paragraph: A weekend of activity serves as an indication that a crackdown continues under the new president, Abdel Fattah el-Sisi.

headline.main: Egyptian Police Confiscate Newsletter, Arrest Sign Holders and Close Grocery Stores
headline.print_headline: Egyptian Police Confiscate Newsletter, Arrest Sign Holders and Close Grocery Stores
